SafetyInspectionBy: Columbus Div. of Fire, Bureau of Fire Prevention

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. It is the intent of the Columbus West Terminal to incorporate the most recent construction and procedural guidance (NFPA #58-2011 Edition) into this process. 



Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. The Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one (1) 60,000 gallon (water capacity) butane storage vessel.



Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's (Sunoco Partners Butane Blending, LLC) specifications.



In the event of an emergency involving the Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Columbus Fire Department (Primary Responder, Station #26) and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with fire department and the Franklin County Emergency Management.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, the Colu
mbus Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
